conclusion: Analyze motion using the v-t graph.
Graph shows velocity of particles A and B over time.
Area under v-t graph represents displacement.
For A: 0 to t0 velocity increases from 0 to 2v0; t0 to 2t0 decreases from 2v0 to 0; 2t0 to 3t0 increases from 0 to v0.
For B: 0 to 3t0 velocity increases from 0 to v0; 3t0 to 5t0 constant at v0; 5t0 to 6t0 decreases from v0 to 0.
Calculate displacement for A from 0 to t0: Area = v0 t0.
Calculate displacement for A from t0 to 2t0: Area = v0 t0.
Calculate displacement for A from 2t0 to 3t0: Area = 0.5 v0 t0.
Total displacement for A = 2.5 v0 t0.
Calculate displacement for B from 0 to 3t0: Area = 1.5 v0 t0.
Calculate displacement for B from 3t0 to 5t0: Area = 2 v0 t0.
Calculate displacement for B from 5t0 to 6t0: Area = 0.5 v0 t0.
Total displacement for B = 4 v0 t0.
A and B meet when displacements are equal: 2.5 v0 t0 = 4 v0 t0.
Equation does not hold for entire intervals; find specific time.
Graphical analysis shows areas equal at t = 4t0.
Particles A and B meet at t = 4t0.
